question.text: The results of the traveler preference survey are___.

answer.explanation: (D) The “results” surprise others; it is active, so the present participle is used. Choice (A) is the past participle. Choice (B) is the present tense. Choice (C) is the base form of the verb.

question.text: The Watdee Marketing Firm will guide you in ___ promoting your product to the most desirable business customers.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the verb "promoting" so we use an adverb.

question.text: We will review your application___you have submitted all your paperwork.

answer.explanation: (C) “As soon as”, meaning “immediately after”, introduces the time clause. Choices (A), (B), and (D) cannot be used to introduce a time clause.

question.text: To save time and costs, Alberta Industries recommends that any associates who travel for business ___ the amount of luggage they carry.
At the end of next month, executive chef Tracy Nakagawathe ____ kitchen at the Hokulea Cafe for ten years.

answer.explanation: "Next month" means that the action is in the future. There is also "for ten years" so we use future perfect tense.

question.text: The coffee makers we compared ___ in terms of price, size, and durability.

answer.explanation:
Vary = Have differences
The subject "coffee makers" is in its plural form so we choose "vary".

question.text: We cannot ship the order now because our___is low.

answer.explanation: (B) “Inventory” means “stock”. Choices (A), (C), and (D) look similar to the correct answer but don’t have the correct meaning.

question.text: ___we were careful with expenses, we still went over our budget this year.

answer.explanation: (D) “Even though” is used to indicate a contradiction. Choice (A) indicates a condition. Choice (B) and (C) indicate cause and effect.

question.text: Patrons who arrive at the theater ___ the show has begun will not be seated until the intermission.

answer.explanation: While the first clause uses simple present tense, the second clause uses perfect present tense. This means that the second clause happens before the first clause so we use "after".

question.text: Kyung Bin Yi has been praised for her role in securing several ___ contracts for Dwyer Industries' fledgling mobile-computing division.
